column4: is there a way to network a windows computer and ubuntu so can share files between them?
yes
you have a link that explains it?
samba will talk to and share files
is it easy to setup?
I would guess there is a gui utility in Ubuntu somewhere
I use a limited subset with smbfs mount of windows shares so I can back them up on Linuc, that is from Windows to Linux
the other way around requires more and samba is the most common choice
webmin has a section for setting up samba shares as does swat
the biggest gotcha in getting things to work is that windows 9x does passwords in the clear, 2000 does encrypted passwords and xp will do either
there is a small registry change for 2000 and doing passwords in the clear will work for both 9x and xp
yeah this is a 98 machine
do you mean a dual boot, if these are two separate machines set passwords to clear in samba
just noticed a file sharing item under system administration
install samba, webmin, webmin core and see if webmin will give gui access to you samba mounts, do set passwords to clear text
it is confusing, your head may hurt a little, try to log in to webmin - https://localhost:10000/
look for samba under servers
try sudo apt-get install webmin-core, webmin alone comes up bare
webmin and debian part ways over apache, I hop samba works
my bad, this is going to get even more difficult

i apologize, i am probably leading you into the tulips. http://www.howtoforge.com/samba_setup_ubuntu_5.10_p5?from=10&comments_per_page=10 describes a domain server setup which is more complicated than you need but maybe it will help
